thread.title: A Hawaii Food Festival Goes Local
thread.title_full: A Hawaii Food Festival Goes Local - The New York Times

author: Matt Beardmore
title: A Hawaii Food Festival Goes Local
text:
The fifth annual Hawaii Food & Wine Festival runs from Aug. 29 to Sept. 13 on the islands of Hawaii , Maui and Oahu.
Festivalgoers (10,000 are expected) will get a true taste of Hawaii, as the more than 100 chefs participating will prepare dishes using locally grown products.
“We have an executive chef in Honolulu that will coordinate the procurement,” said Denise Yamaguchi, the executive director of the festival. “It’s a huge undertaking, but that’s what makes us different. We showcase the local agriculture and the beauty of the island.”
The festival, founded by the chefs Roy Yamaguchi and Alan Wong, begins with the “Seven Chefs, One Big Island” event at the Hilton Waikoloa Village, then shifts to Maui for five events over three consecutive days, starting with Mr. Yamaguchi’s annual golf tournament at the Kaanapali Golf Course on Sept. 4.
